item.description:
Since the concert starts at 8:00 pm, I think that we should meet to car pool around 5:30 to get there in time and get a seat.
Though I have seen concerts at the Wolf Den from the casino area
instead of getting a seat in the Den itself.

Traffic is really bad on I 95 and it gets worst the better the weather gets.

The first car pool location will be Barnes & Nobel in Milford.

Will anyone else be meeting us along I 95 North?

The concert will be at the Wolf's Den at the Mohegan Sun.

Is anyone going to meet us at the Mohegan Sun,
then I will contact those so we can say where to meet.
Maybe the water fall or somewhere else?

In 1990, Slaughter hit radio, MTV & the U.S. touring circuit like a
tornado - coming seemingly out of nowhere to roll through everything
in its path & turn it upside down.
Touring the world with artists that they loved like Kiss, Ozzy Osbourne &
others meant the good times were just a song away.
Their first hit single "Up All Night" certainly fit into that mold while their
second chart-topper "Fly To The Angels"
was more representative of the spirituality & awareness that goes into
most of the band's music & lyrics.
But never was Slaughter more accurately represented than live onstage
in front of their legions of devoted fans over the last ten years.

*Come early.
Seating is limited.
Must be 21 or older.
Times & performers are subject to change.
